summary:
I use math, domain knowledge and scientific methods to gain understanding and reach valuable insights for the companies I work in. What I enjoy most is to work with a team on interesting problems that impact business decisions, and while doing it get to learn and understand new things, as well as share my knowledge. In my career I’ve had several changes in environment and fields, which strengthened my ability to adapt to new circumstances, to quickly learn new skills, and to be a versatile team member. I am also skilled at presenting and explaining complex concepts in a simple way, and creating a story out of the data so that anyone in the company can understand it and give their input.

Keywords: Data Analysis, Algorithm Development, Data Science, Data Visualization, Modeling and Computer Simulations, Analytical and Statistical Estimation Techniques, PhD, Python, R, SQL, Tableau, MATLAB, C++

awards.title: Nominated for Student Paper Award
awards.description:
Only 18 papers were selected, out of hundreds of student submissions to the conference. Scoring of the submissions was made according to the following criteria:
1. Degree of originality, innovation, novelty and/or contribution to the advancement of knowledge 
2. Importance and/or topicality of the work 
3. Work performed to a high scientific standard 
4. Presentation, organization and clarity of the summary 
5. Data and results should have actually been obtained and not just anticipated

projects.title: GhentMUN (Ghent Model United Nations) 2016
projects.description: An MUN conference is a simulation of the United Nations. For one weekend, I became a diplomat and defended a country’s interests in a UN committee (General Assembly (DISEC): Biological weapons). I debated the topic with the representatives of other countries, and collaborated in writing and approving a resolution with my fellow delegates.

projects.title: TEDxGhent PhD Contest 2014
projects.description: I was one of only six PhD students of the Ghent University selected to give a talk at the TEDxGhent PhD Contest 2014, which was open to the general public. You can watch it here: http://youtu.be/ubTA5lJhQgI .

profile_positions.description:
I provide analytical insights and dashboards for my stakeholders to make better decisions. I've worked, among other things, on:
- Product impact analysis and performance tracking
- Recruitment funnel analysis
- Identifying data quality issues and their size
- Helping our team define a new scope and grow relationships with new stakeholders
I've worked on the following topics: partner products, operational health, recruitment and HR.
Tools: R, Python, SQL, Tableau, Spark / Hadoop

Booking.com is one of the world's largest online travel marketplaces, with a large community of Data Scientists and Data Analysts. As such I've had the opportunity to handle large amounts of data and learn a lot from my peers.
profile_positions.title: Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Withlocals is a curated online marketplace that connects travelers with locals, in many cities around the world, to create more meaningful and authentic experiences.

I helped the entire team get data insights on the Withlocals portfolio of experiences, as well as hosts and guests. My main tasks included:
- defining the correct (and most relevant) questions to ask and the best way to answer them with the available data
- querying the database (SQL) to get the data needed
- data cleaning and data analysis (Python, Tableau), often to find issues or business opportunities
- creating dashboards (Tableau) to make it easy for the team to access the data they need to make informed decisions
- communicating my findings and reports to different stakeholders

I have also started, out of my own initiative, the "masterclass" program at Withlocals, with the main goal of improving the technical knowledge and data literacy in the company.
profile_positions.title: Data Scientist

profile_positions.description:
I worked in the D&E System Focus Performance group at ASML. My main task was to perform statistical analysis on data from ASML systems to assess their focus performance. If I detected an issue I looked for the root-cause, supported by my physics background and the knowledge about the systems which I've acquired through courses and experience at the company. The other crucial part of my job was to collaborate with other teams within ASML and to clearly present my findings to various stakeholders.

ASML is the world's leading provider of lithography systems for the semiconductor industry, manufacturing complex machines that are critical to the production of integrated circuits or chips.

(I was deployed there by TMC)
profile_positions.title: Data Analyst

profile_positions.description:
I was part of TMC Data Science, who partners with companies with challenges related to Data Science. Through TMC, I worked as a Data Analyst for ASML, and with the help of TMC developed several soft-skills. I also helped to improve TMC's visibility and find potential partners. As a side project for TMC Data Science, I researched and wrote a report with statistics and insights about individuals working in the field of Data Science.

TMC is an innovation consultancy company spread across several countries. The company helps and encourages consultants to grow and be entrepreneurs in their own job (that is, constantly looking for new opportunities and being pro-active about them).
profile_positions.title: Consultant - Algorithm Developer

profile_positions.description:
I worked at the Medical Imaging and Signal Processing Group (MEDISIP) of Ghent University (IBiTech, iMinds). My research was focused on evaluation of image quality in Single Photon Emission Computed Tomography (SPECT), as well as the design and optimization of small animal SPECT systems.

The major component of my work was done using computer simulations (in MATLAB, CUDA and GATE), for which I developed, adapted and implemented several mathematical algorithms.

I also came up with an innovative collimator design for a highly compact stationary SPECT system, with several advantages compared to the systems available at the time. I successfully applied for a patent for this invention, and I developed the idea to show its feasibility in practice using mainly simulations.
profile_positions.title: PhD Researcher (Biomedical Engineering)

profile_positions.description:
I was part of the team that organizes TEDxGhent, an event taking place every year in May/June with about 600 attendees. We also organized several smaller events throughout the academic year. 
My main responsibility was to lead the Content Team, which is in charge of the research and selection of the speakers to be invited for the event and all the related practicalities (invitation, follow-up...).

Under my leadership, the number of speaker cancellations went from 60% to 10% and two of the talks of the main event were considered by the global TED organization to be of high enough quality to go on their own website (which had never happened before). The overall satisfaction of the speakers with the event and of the team with the quality of the talks was significantly higher than previous years, thanks to all the new procedures I developed with my team.

TEDx conferences are independently organised TED-like events, which follow TED's mission of "ideas worth spreading"​. At the event, a series of speakers present their innovative ideas in an engaging way to a broad audience. We believe that this can open people's minds to new ideas and world-views, and inspire them to change their lives and the world, which is what motivated me to work in this amazing organisation.
profile_positions.title: Team Lead (Content Team)

profile_positions.description: I was involved in the organization of the TEDxGhent 2015 conference (June 2015), as well as other TEDxGhent events throughout the academic year. In particular, I was part of the Content Team, which focused on the selection of the themes covered and the speakers invited for the event, as well as on the contact and all practicalities related to the speakers. I also played an important role in the organisation of the TEDxGhent PhD Contest 2015, in which we achieved a 5-fold increase in the number of applications compared to the previous year.
profile_positions.title: Staff Member (Content Team)

profile_positions.description: As a consultant for PreScouter, I worked on projects tackling specific technology-related problems, posed by clients. I researched articles, patents, etc., for technologies/innovations/start-ups/lines-of-research which addressed the client's problem, and then recommended several solutions to the client over the course of the project. During this process I discussed and collaborated remotely with other global scholars and the client's company personnel, to arrive at the most appropriate solutions.
profile_positions.title: Global Scholar Consultant

volunteer_experiences.role: Improvisational Theater Player, Teacher and Host
volunteer_experiences.description:
I play improvisational theater, which basically means there is no script, just a set of guiding principles which help you create magical, unrepeatable moments on stage with your fellow players. You have to think quick, take risks, and trust your partners. All extremely important skills that everyone should develop.
With my group Chili Con Comedy, I regularly perform on improv shows, teach improv classes and host improv jams.
Working in a team to find and research possible speakers, decide on the best candidates and then coach them to develop an amazing TEDx talk.

Integration of foreigners is one of the biggest challenges that Europe is currently facing. The Hub Eindhoven is a non-profit organization that aims to make the city of Eindhoven a welcoming place to expats. They organize many different events in English (informative, cultural, social, networking...) that are open to anyone. Through them, newcomers and locals gather to have fun doing things that they enjoy, and connect with people from all walks of life.
This organization helped me a lot when I first arrived in Eindhoven, and made the transition to this new city very easy. As I would like this to happen to everyone coming to Eindhoven, I now contribute to the organization by volunteering as a bartender and also organizing Board Games Nights.

As a mentor for CoderDojo Gent, I help kids and teenagers to discover the world of programming in a fun and interactive way. I believe that this empowers them to use their creativity and intelligence in a productive way for society, and that it opens doors for their future.

CoderDojo is a global network of volunteer-led, independent, community based programming clubs for young people. These young people, between 7 and 17, learn how to code, develop websites, apps, programs, games and explore technology. In addition to learning to code attendees meet like minded people and get to show off what they’ve been working on. There is a focus on community, peer learning, youth mentoring and self led learning with an emphasis on openness, helping others and showing how coding is a force for change in the world. CoderDojo makes development and learning to code a fun, sociable, kick ass experience.
